Reviews.Title: “Good value for budget motel”
Reviews.Author: Spoonette
Reviews.Content: We traveled with teenagers who wanted to visit University of Illinois on a college hunting tour. By staying at Red Roof, we were able to book two rooms rather than one at a more upscale hotel. The rooms were clean, and everything functioned properly. Staff was very pleasant and friendly. They had hot coffee for us in the morning, and every time we saw an employee, they asked if we needed anything. I would recommend this motel if you're looking for basic accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “worst ever”
Reviews.Author: valleylass03
Reviews.Content: no coffee pot carpet filthy bed like a hammock roadway sign gives one price but charged more

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for everything Nancy & Nicole!”
Reviews.Author: Michele S
Reviews.Content: I'm a business travler. Recently my job took me to Champaign, IL for 8 weeks. Unable to find affordable accomodations in an extended stay facility, I booked with Red Roof Inn. They offered an affordable alternative. No stove? Not an issue for a seasoned business travler with a crockpot! The room was very comfortable, clean and for the majority of my stay, very quite. The staff was excellent...friendly and attentive. Clean towels and rubbish removal every day. This is an older hotel, but well maintained. Oh, and close to every resturant you could ever need.

Reviews.Title: “Clean enough budget hotel, some safety concerns”
Reviews.Author: Steph H
Reviews.Content: My hotel room was clean, it wasn't in the best condition but for the price it was about what you'd expect. The t.v. worked just fine, there were no problems with the shower or the sink, the bed was clean and made each day. At night the hotel was relatively quiet, the heating unit functioned well and wasn't too loud. The only major issue I had with this hotel is that I lost my key and had to go to the front desk to get a new one. The front desk clerk issued me a new key when I told him my room number. I had not seen this desk clerk before, he did not ask my name or for any form of ID from me. This was a bit disconcerting as, I'm guessing you could walk in and ask for the room key for any room and get it depending on who was working the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Enough, But Shabby”
Reviews.Author: MichiganBanjoMan
Reviews.Content: This place could use some significant updating. The carpet was worn, and the wallpaper was peeling. Our room lacked fairly standard amenities such as a coffee pot and hair dryer. There was an unidentifiable film in the bathtub, either caused by abrasive cleaners or residual soap scum (I wasn't motivated to examine it very closely). Overall, the room was adequately clean, and the bed was comfortable. But its price certainly didn't make this room a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: KOURT MICHELLE S
Reviews.Content: The room was a disgusting mess. The carpet was coming up off of the floor. The carpet had clearly not been vacuumed. The table was a sticky mess and my arm literally stuck to it. The sheets had cigarette ashes and stains all over them. We had one light that worked. We then went to the bathroom and the shower was literally orange from the disgusting mildew. False advertising was an issue because we were told there would be a blow dryer and a fridge and a microwave and there wasnt any of these in the room. The furniture had holes in them and the tv was bolted to the desk!!! The AC did not work and it was and and smelled of stale smoke. I do not recommend staying in this place. We packed our bags and went elsewhere!!!

Reviews.Title: “Staff great, hotel a bit shabby”
Reviews.Author: innominate
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly, the wifi worked well, and the price was right. The rooms were shabbier than other Red Roofs where I've stayed recently. The Sleep Inn where I stayed a week later was much better for a few dollars more.

Reviews.Title: “great customer service! nicole wonderful manager!”
Reviews.Author: robinnap
Reviews.Content: Always have been treated like a queen whenever I have stayed. Friendly and helpful goes along way in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid RRI Champaign, stay at one of many other local hotels!”
Reviews.Author: KCLJ520
Reviews.Content: My wife and I both went to U of I and return with our relatives and friends for a football game every season. This is our first and last stay at RRI Champaign. When we arrived at 4 PM, we had a fine experience with the woman at the desk, but when we went to our room, we found broken glass in the corridor outside of our room that our dog stepped in (fortunately not hurting himself!). I let the desk know and she assured me it would be taken care of. At 9:30 PM when we came back, the glass was still there. It was also still there upon our check out at 9 AM the next morning. Our carpet in the room, as well as the floor and wallpaper in the bathroom were filthy, and there was a hole in the bedspread. Walls were thin, and Champaign football weekends are noisy anyway, we figured that, not the hotel's fault. For the money ($105/ night), we felt we could have stayed in a much nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible....”
Reviews.Author: beastie3
Reviews.Content: I booked this room through www.illinois-hotels.org. It was absolutely the worse motel room I have ever stayed in for the rate I paid. The motel was advertising at the property 1/2 the rate that I paid through the reservation service. Carpets were stained, furniture was severally damaged, sink caulk was missing and mildewed and the lint build up on the shower exhaust fan was a month or more worth off accumulation. I contacted the management and the reservation service requesting a discounted credit on my rate paid and neither would take ownership and provide any kind of resolution for the poor quality of the motel. I would not recommend and will not every stay at another Red Roof Inn!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT MANG AND FRONT DESK”
Reviews.Author: farmergal38
Reviews.Content: i would like to say what a great mang and front desk people you have at this location. you dont find that much.ive stayed at other red roofs and they have not been so nice or helpful. they deserve alot. they keep your place running. you need to fix the place up and i know thats not the mangs fault . you have let this location go. sad to see.you should think of that investment.

Reviews.Title: “We will not return”
Reviews.Author: guavagirlKW
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at this Red Roof. We thought perhaps our first time in 2008 we just got a bad room. Wrong. This room was worse than the last. The carpeting was filthy. The bathroom door was literally held together with packing tape. I should have taken a picture. The furniture should have been retired years ago. It was way below thrift store. The lampshades were torn and mismatched. Worst of all was the bathroom. The seat had been left up and there were "dried drops" on the rim of the bowl. If housekeeping cleans anything in the room it should be the toilet. If that is not clean, everything else is suspect. There were also sticky smears on the furniture that could have easily been wiped off. I am not a snob or a particularly fussy person. I can adapt to used furniture and tired beds, but I will not tolerate filth. I highly recommend you stay elsewhere. This place need a total overhaul. I also hate the fact that you have to go to the office in the morning to have them remove the safe fee. When I went to the office it was closed. I stood 10 minutes in the cold air waiting for the morning person to return to the office. She said she was checking the rooms. It seems she should be there to check people out.

Reviews.Title: “Better hotels out there”
Reviews.Author: argonauts52
Reviews.Content: Not close to anything. Walls are super thin. Renovation needed. There are plenty of better hotels in Champaign/Urbana area than this one. This happened to be the only one with rooms available during one night home football game. Will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room for the price”
Reviews.Author: tonygabes
Reviews.Content: The room was great for the price we paid. Not everyone likes rooms where the door opens to the parking lot as opposed to a hallway, but the area felt safe. The room was clean and the beds were satisfactory. No Wi-Fi.

Reviews.Title: “Too many unexpected exceptions”
Reviews.Author: Skiffymom
Reviews.Content: I had not stayed in a Red Roof Inn before, and I'm not sure I will again. On the Internet listing it looked as if this place had high-speed Internet, a microwave, and an in-room refrigerator among the room amenities. I've stayed at other places where these were included when they were in the listing, so I did not expect that you had to go to a higher room class than a basic two-bed no-smoking to get the fridge and microwave. Nor was it clear to us on the web site that there was a charge for the Internet! Add to that the moldy bathroom ceiling, and I'll stay other places from now on, thanks!

Reviews.Title: “The price was right.”
Reviews.Author: Roadsscholar
Reviews.Content: I'd read other reviews on Trip Advisor and decided this hotel would suit our needs for just one night at the end of a full day of driving. It did just that. The room was clean, the location was just off the interstate, and the internet was free (with a king room). A card in the room talked about the new upgraded bed linens and pillows that Red Roof was using, but I don't think that improvement has made it to Champaign yet. However, at $50/night, I didn't expect much. The free coffee in the lobby was terrible, but again...

Reviews.Title: “Ask for extra towels”
Reviews.Author: MountaineerMavin
Reviews.Content: When we checked in the clerk said the upstairs rooms were nicer because they are not used as often. After seeing our room I hate to think what the downstairs rooms are like! Maybe the stairs explain why the room looked like it had not been vacuumed in several years. There was a band of grey around the entire room,a thick layer of dust under the beds and crumbs on the floor. The bathroom fixtures were clean but you could clearly see mildew on the walls and ceiling of the bathroom. The phone and alarm clock were untouchable.The chairs were so stained I could not bring myself to sit in them. I asked for lots of extra towels to cover them and considered covering the floor as well but ended up wearing my shoes the whole time. The staff was nice, but I don't think they venture out from behind the counter. We did not bother to look for another hotel, we got there late,the town was booked and it was a short stay. My advice is get there before 6:00 so you can check the room first and leave!

Reviews.Title: “Basic rooms, good value”
Reviews.Author: graciediane
Reviews.Content: Basic and simple, but clean. The hotel is located near the mall. Surrounded by a group of other hotel-motel chains. Baymont, La Quinta, etc. can all be found in the same general area. This was the best priced motel in that location. The night we arrived there was a drunk man (wino) wandering the parking lot. This concerned us at first, but he never bothered us. The front desk clerk was helpful and nice. Families with dogs can stay here. The stairwells could use a new paint job, but overall it was just fine for a cheap and comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Motel fot the $$$$$”
Reviews.Author: bald3eagle
Reviews.Content: We came from Texas to move our son into grad school @ the university. Great place for the $. Stayed 3 days. No problems. Desk was very helpful with all our questions about the area .eating places,shopping,etc. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If I was back to this city, I would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Aoarashi
Reviews.Content: Great value for the money. Certainly there are more fancy hotels far more expensive, but for this money one gets a clean room and good rest. The neighborhood is rather boring, except there is a Banana Republic shop in a walking distance (shopping mall) :o] I stayed in Champaign for nearly 2 extremely busy weeks. Even though I had to cycle quiet a distance to my meeting place everyday, next time I will stay in the same hotel. The price was approximately 40% of a place where my colleagues stayed. So they had to eat american food for 2 weeks and in addition didn't get any exercise! Poor guys.

Reviews.Title: “Tried to make a reservation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I tried to make a reservation at this hotel on Saturday night. We were traveling to Champaign for a family funeral. Unfortunately, the young woman that answered the phone was much more interested in giggling, putting me on hold (which she did three times for several minutes apiece), and asking me my name again...and again...and again... Didn't promote confidence in my reservation being there when I got there if she couldn't even get my name into the computer. When I mentioned this to her, she got very belligerent and told me she didn't care if I stayed at the Red Roof or not, she had thousands of things she was trying to do and really didn't care to be bothered with me. I regret (I think) that I don't know what this hotel is like (other than the price is very reasonable), because at that point I gave up and called another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quality for the price”
Reviews.Author: GFKelly
Reviews.Content: We were staying on a Sunday, and when we arrived at noon, both of our rooms were ready. It is a nice Red Roof, with nothing special but the price. It passed my biggest test when the sheets stayed on the bed, which other hotels in this class often fail.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Red Roof!”
Reviews.Author: lmssks
Reviews.Content: This was a great stop over hotel on our road trip. We got in fairly late, our room was promptly given to us, it was clean and nice. It was on a fairly busy exit, a university is nearby - it seemed safe, we felt good about staying here. The rooms have private entrances. (no lobby's to walk through) The attendant the next morning suggested that we try Aroma Coffee shop - by the university. What a great place it was... quirky modern art deco, great coffee, and great bakery goods! Try the orange/cream cheese poppy seed bread! Or - you can go across the street to the mall - one of the bookstores there had Starbucks. A good little hotel, in a nice community!

HotelInfo.Name: Red Roof Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 212 West Anthony Drive, Champaign, IL 61820
